meanings.definition: Unable to be calculated or determined.
meanings.sent1: The complexity of the problem made it incomputable for the students to solve.
meanings.sent2: The scientist encountered an incomputable amount of data to analyze.
meanings.sent3: The cat found the idea of chasing its own tail incomputable and amusing.
meanings.sent4: Her love for him was incomputable, like trying to measure the depth of the ocean with a teaspoon.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of the sunset was incomputable, leaving everyone in awe.

meanings.definition: Incapable of being computed or processed.
meanings.sent1: The old computer was so slow that it seemed incomputable to run any modern software on it.
meanings.sent2: The ancient manuscript was written in a language that was incomputable by the translation software.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a robot taking over the world was incomputable and made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: His anger was incomputable, like a storm brewing on the horizon.
meanings.sent5: The magnitude of the disaster was incomputable, leaving everyone speechless.
